subproject.corporate outcome:
1. Strengthened national/local management and coordination to improve service delivery in the areas of prevention, treatment, care, support, and impact mitigation. 
2. Mainstreaming of HIV and AIDS, gender, and human rights into national development plans and budgets, and advocating for a scaled-up multi-sectoral response to the pandemic.
subproject.description: Under auspices of the Joint United Nations on HIV Programme Support (2009-2015), UNDP has the mandate to support the coordination and management of the response. A human rights-based and gender sensitive HIV and AIDS response strategy will be employed in supporting the national efforts for effective Monitoring and Evaluation as well as undertaking of assessments that inform future undertaking of both the UN and the national counterparts. Strengthening of the National Emergency Response Council on HIV and AIDS is key, together with identified sectors, both public and civil to harmonize systems and procedures for an efficient delivery of services.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Support for HIV Response
